moves.1. e4 e6: The French Defense is tough to crack.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Bd3 dxe4 5. Nxe4: If Qxd4? then Bb5+ winning the Queen with the discovered attack.
moves.5... Be7 6. Nf3 O-O 7. O-O Nc6 8. c3 Nd5: Black moves his knight twice to prevent Bf4, but Bf4 comes later anyways.
moves.9. Qc2 a6 10. Re1 b5: Black has nothing on the Queenside. His Kingside has been weakened after the knight moved away.
moves.15. Bf4 bxc3 16. bxc3 Nh5 17. Bh2 Na5: A k"night" on the edge is dim. Both Black's knights are dim.
moves.18. Be4 Bxe4 19. Rxe4 Nc4 20. Rae1 Rb8 2: Sacrificing the knight for 2 pawns to open the e-file for the rooks
moves.23. Qd3: Now both the black knight and bishop are under attack.
moves.23... Rxf3: Black returns material by sac-ing the exchange.
moves.25. Qd3 Kf7: Black is about to lose more material (Bishop + Queen for 2 Rooks is much better for White).
moves.26. Re6xe7+: Here, Black ran out of time, but disconnected immediately in anger.
